snippet: Scientists think that abnormal protein deposits inside brain cells cause frontotemporal degeneration.
abstract: University of California, San Francisco, studies of frontotemporal degeneration are leading scientists to believe that the dementia is caused by abnormal protein deposits inside brain cells; proteins vary, but they do not include amyloid, the substance found in Alzheimer's patients.
lead_paragraph: Scientists think that abnormal protein deposits inside brain cells cause frontotemporal degeneration.

headline.seo: Tying Genes and Proteins to Dementia
headline.main: Studies Tie Abnormal Protein Buildup to Dementia
headline.print_headline: Studies Tie Abnormal Protein Buildup to Dementia
